com.att.research.xacml.std

Class StdMutableAttributeCategory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacml.std.StdMutableAttributeCategory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeCategory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StdMutableRequestAttributes

    public class StdMutableAttributeCategory
extends java.lang.Object
implements AttributeCategory
    Mutable implementation of the AttributeCategory interface.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StdMutableAttributeCategory()
      Creates a new StdMutableAttributeCategory with all default values.
      StdMutableAttributeCategory(AttributeCategory attributeCategory)
      Creates a new StdMutableAttributeCategory that is a copy of the given AttributeCategory.
      StdMutableAttributeCategory(Identifier identifierCategory, java.util.Collection<Attribute> listAttributes)
      Creates a new StdMutableAttributeCategory with the given Identifier representing its XACML Category, and the given Collection of Attributes as its XACML Attributes.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Attribute attribute)
      Adds a Attribute to this StdMutableAttributeCategory>
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Implementations of the AttributeCategory interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two AttributeCategorys (a1 and a2) are equal if: a1.getCategory().equals(a2.getCategory()) AND The Attributes in a1 and a2 are pairwise equal.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StdMutableAttributeCategory

        public StdMutableAttributeCategory()
        Creates a new StdMutableAttributeCategory with all default values.

      • StdMutableAttributeCategory

        public StdMutableAttributeCategory(Identifier identifierCategory,
                           java.util.Collection<Attribute> listAttributes)
        Creates a new StdMutableAttributeCategory with the given Identifier representing its XACML Category, and the given Collection of Attributes as its XACML Attributes. The Collection is copied; changes made to the Collection after creating the new StdMutableAttributeCategory are not reflected in the StdMutableAttributeCategory.
        Parameters:
        identifierCategory - the Identifier for the XACML Category for the new StdMutableAttributeCategory.
        listAttributes - a Collection of Attributes for the new StdMutableAttributeCategory.

      • StdMutableAttributeCategory

        public StdMutableAttributeCategory(AttributeCategory attributeCategory)
        Creates a new StdMutableAttributeCategory that is a copy of the given AttributeCategory.
        Parameters:
        attributeCategory - the AttributeCategory to copy

      • getAttributes

        public java.util.Collection<Attribute> getAttributes()
        Description copied from interface: AttributeCategory
        Gets the Collection of Attributes in this AttributeCategory. If there are no Attributes in this AttributeCategory then an empty Collection must be returned. The returned Collection should not be modified. Implementations are free to return an immutable view to enforce this.
        Specified by:
        getAttributes in interface AttributeCategory
        Returns:
        the Collection of Attributes in this AttributeCategory.

      • hasAttributes

        public boolean hasAttributes(Identifier attributeId)
        Description copied from interface: AttributeCategory
        Determines if there is at least one Attribute in this AttributeCategory whose XACML AttributeId matches the given Identifier.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Description copied from interface: AttributeCategory
        Implementations of the AttributeCategory interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two AttributeCategorys (a1 and a2) are equal if: a1.getCategory().equals(a2.getCategory()) AND The Attributes in a1 and a2 are pairwise equal.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface AttributeCategory
        Overrides:
